casebody.data:
WILLOWMERE COMMUNITY ASSOCIATION, INC., et al.
v.
CITY OF CHARLOTTE, et al. 419PA16-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. March 21, 2017 Kenneth T. Davies, Attorney at Law, Madeline J. Trilling, Attorney at Law, for Willomere Community Association, Inc., et al. Anthony T. Lathrop, Attorney at Law, Glenn E. Ketner, III, Attorney at Law, Kara N. Bitar, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for Charlotte-Mecklenburg Housing Partnership, Inc. Terrie V. Hagler-Gray, Senior Assistant City Attorney, Thomas E. Powers, III, Assistant City Attorney, for City of Charlotte.

The following order has been entered on the Motion for Extension of Time to File Brief filed on the 17th of March 2017 by Defendants:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 21st of March 2017."

Defendants shall have up to and including the 10th day of April 2017 to file and serve his/her brief with this Court.
